item.title: (Remove)
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:32, topic:352228”][quote author=glestrts link=topic=448581.msg3298891#msg3298891 date=1281141732]

goodluck, have fun with pathfinding and player clipping.

do you know what clipping is

obviously not in your opinion, but to my understanding it was the movement of the player, that took into account objects, so i guess when I said both i was repetitive, and so I beg your forgiveness.
O great super_, my heart bleeds for you, that you felt you had to point out this error, and I wish you a good day.

That Is All Thank You

Your Welcome, @davidi2, any updates?
[/quote]Yes, I have most of the login finished, but I am getting a new error. I’m in debugging right now, it’s saying that the packet sent when the crash happens is -1, which I assume means no packet id (force sent, like the login codes) I would appreciate someone to verify that. Trying to figure it out.[/quote]

would ask u to pm me ur source so i can help but im at an internet cafe in the middle of europe

Read full topic

item.title: (Remove)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:26, topic:352228”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=448581.msg3291647#msg3291647 date=1280644883]

So it allows connections, logs in, reads correct data, username, pass etc, but now I need to change the things that happen AFTER initial login (map regions, configs etc) and I plan to work on that tomorrow. I plan to keep you updated.
[/quote]

thats as simple as changing the packet id lol[/quote]Partly yes; but I also need to change the order for most of the packets sent as well. And the source I have uses different methods for writing to the stream, I needed to edit all of those as well.

Read full topic

item.title: (Remove)
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:9, topic:352272”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=448581.msg3295225#msg3295225 date=1280895004]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=448581.msg3295210#msg3295210 date=1280894429]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=448581.msg3295205#msg3295205 date=1280894258]
you might as well setup a map<integer, packethandler>
[/quote]A hashmap would work fine, but the switch statement works too
[/quote]do you realize how ridiculous it is that you are calling all implementations of Packet’s virtual handlePacket() function with the SAME EXACT ARGUMENTS…learn proper polymorphism ffs

the fact that a switch statement works doesn’t excuse the fact that it’s a shitty alternative, and not to mention, even more time consuming than what it takes to setup the map
[/quote]I. Didn’t. Write. It.[/quote]

Then why not take advantage of this opportunity to do so? Really, there’s only 2 reasons. Either, you lack the mental capacity, or you lack the ability to type. Given that you’re posting on a forum, I have my doubts as to the latter.

Read full topic

item.title: (Remove)

item.title: (Remove)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote="_Vengeance, post:21, topic:352228"][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=448581.msg3294063#msg3294063 date=1280817745]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=448581.msg3294036#msg3294036 date=1280815638]
If you had written it properly in the first place, you would write a new packet encoder/decoder and it would “just work”.

How about not working with shit in the first place ;). Although, I think you’re gonna fail. Almost everything is gonna be useless since you have to find out all new packet IDs, packet structures, and redo the player updating procedure.
[/quote]My server just uses a switch statement to handle the ID’s, should be easy to change. The old packets shouldn’t have changed to much in structure, and if they have I’ll just look at a 562 and use them.

The packet ids AND structures (order and such) change EVERY SINGLE VERSION. Just in case you didn’t know.
[/quote]I didn’t write the packet handler; or really any of the real source. But that is what I’m doing, going through each of the packets and changing the switch statement. But the source I have is so poorly written that I also need to go through my frames (actionsender) and change a ton of things there too.

Why the fuck are you using a huge switch statement? That’s such a terrible method.
If you’re going to rewrite the packet handling system, why not write it properly, instead of going from a disabled kid to a fat kid on crutches. Although, I don’t suppose you’d be capable of writing anything useful/efficient if your life depended on it, regardless.[/quote]I never said I was rewriting the packet handling system (I didn’t even write it in the first place, Palidino did) , I’m just changing ID’s and the order it reads the data. And what’s wrong with a switch statement? I think you misunderstood me. Each packet has it’s own class, and the switch statement calls each class depending on the ID of the packet. I’m pretty sure most other servers do the same thing, or use an array of the classes.

Read full topic

item.title: (Remove)
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:19, topic:352228”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=448581.msg3294036#msg3294036 date=1280815638]
If you had written it properly in the first place, you would write a new packet encoder/decoder and it would “just work”.

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=448581.msg3291746#msg3291746 date=1280658999]

How about not working with shit in the first place ;). Although, I think you’re gonna fail. Almost everything is gonna be useless since you have to find out all new packet IDs, packet structures, and redo the player updating procedure.
[/quote]My server just uses a switch statement to handle the ID’s, should be easy to change. The old packets shouldn’t have changed to much in structure, and if they have I’ll just look at a 562 and use them.

The packet ids AND structures (order and such) change EVERY SINGLE VERSION. Just in case you didn’t know.
[/quote]I didn’t write the packet handler; or really any of the real source. But that is what I’m doing, going through each of the packets and changing the switch statement. But the source I have is so poorly written that I also need to go through my frames (actionsender) and change a ton of things there too.[/quote]

Why the fuck are you using a huge switch statement? That’s such a terrible method.
If you’re going to rewrite the packet handling system, why not write it properly, instead of going from a disabled kid to a fat kid on crutches. Although, I don’t suppose you’d be capable of writing anything useful/efficient if your life depended on it, regardless.

Read full topic
